DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Protocol Therapy Begin Administration Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numeric coded response as to whether or not the patient will begin protocol treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Begin Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to start of administration of  therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A coded numeric response for 1 (No) and 2 (Yes) in answer to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
